item.title: Moving by Feel
item.description: It has been driving me nuts to not know. To not know how to move forward. To make progress. To make things better. To “fix”… Amidst much reflection and working on an appreciative inquiry kind of approach (look to what worked previously to find the way forward), I’m realizing something: whenever I’ve faced really tough situations or crises, I’ve felt my way out. I moved by instinct, not really knowing what to do, but simply doing the next thing that FELT right.

item.title: When There Is No Answer
item.description: “You may be over-thinking this,” I said to my eldest. photo by Bill Stilwell via Flickr https://flic.kr/p/6aeKfP She had been describing her frustration at some intense emotions/feelings that she just couldn’t make sense of. Once I clarified that I wasn’t questioning the reality of her feelings – we got to talk about something I’ve noticed about myself and my own anxieties and intense emotions. Sometimes, there is no reason why.
